title: Keyerror: 'text' with PICO ebmnlp
body:
I tried to follow you instructions to run the PICO classification with the ebmnlp dataset but it returned a keyvalue error....Meanwhile I was successful at running a couple of other tasks. So, I configured the 'train_allen_nlp.sh' file as follows:
DATASET='ebmnlp'
TASK='pico'
with_finetuning=' '
dataset_size=38124

While running the script the out put below:
###########################################
...........
2019-10-22 09:48:58,836 - INFO - allennlp.common.params - trainer.should_log_learning_rate = False
2019-10-22 09:48:58,837 - INFO - allennlp.common.params - trainer.log_batch_size_period = None
2019-10-22 09:48:58,838 - INFO - allennlp.training.trainer - Beginning training.
2019-10-22 09:48:58,838 - INFO - allennlp.training.trainer - Epoch 0/14
2019-10-22 09:48:58,838 - INFO - allennlp.training.trainer - Peak CPU memory usage MB: 4633.68
2019-10-22 09:48:58,925 - INFO - allennlp.training.trainer - GPU 0 memory usage MB: 1353
2019-10-22 09:48:58,926 - INFO - allennlp.training.trainer - GPU 1 memory usage MB: 10
###################################
came this error:
for (field_name, padding_key) in sorting_keys],
KeyError: 'text'
0%|          | 0/436 [00:00<?, ?it/s]

What do I need to do to fix this error?
